etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a spiral indicating a turning or circling motion; later regularized into a square enclosing another square, evoking going back within a boundary. This visual naturally extends to senses like returning, turning back, or circling to a previous point.

examples.chinese: 我马上回家(我馬上回家)。
他转了一圈又回到起点(他轉了一圈又回到起點)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhuànle yì quān yòu huídào qǐdiǎn.
examples.english: He made a turn and returned to the starting point.

examples.chinese: 请把书还回去(請把書還回去)。
